title: Ravens hiring Bolts' Minter as new head coach
content: The Ravens are hiring Los Angeles Chargers defensive coordinator Jesse Minter as their next head coach, the team announced Thursday.

title: Colts confirm FBI opened probe into Irsay's death
content: The Indianapolis Colts on Thursday acknowledged the existence of an FBI investigation into the death of owner Jim Irsay and the potential involvement of a California doctor who reportedly prescribed him pain pills and ketamine.

title: Rodman contract saga ends with record Spirit deal
content: United States forward Trinity Rodman signed a record three-year contract with the Washington Spirit on Thursday to remain at the club, ending months-long uncertainty over the star's future.

title: Moore returns to court, wants charges dismissed
content: Ex-Michigan coach Sherrone Moore returned to court, with his lawyer saying he's seeking to have home invasion and other charges against him dismissed.

title: Lawyer suing NFLPA for retaliation fired by union
content: Attorney Heather McPhee says the union wanted to keep her from cooperating with a federal inquiry into NFLPA finances.

title: Nationals send Gore to Rangers in 5-for-1 trade
content: The Rangers have acquired All-Star left-hander MacKenzie Gore from the Nationals in exchange for five prospects, including Gavin Fien, the 12th pick in the draft.

title: QB Dart: Giants 'can't wait' to play for Harbaugh
content: Giants quarterback Jaxson Dart told ESPN that he and his teammates "can't wait" to play for new coach John Harbaugh.

title: Kansas' Self plans to return vs. Kansas State
content: Kansas coach Bill Self intends to be on the sideline Saturday night when the No. 19 Jayhawks travel to play Kansas State.

title: üèà NFL mock draft: Kiper projects the first round
content: Where will national title game standouts Fernando Mendoza and Akheem Mesidor land in Round 1? And could we really see six WRs in the opening 32 picks?

title: Follow live: Osaka apologizes for 'disrespectful' comments, Alcaraz in action
content: Third round singles action begins at the Australian Open on Friday with world No. 1s Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka, as well as American star Coco Gauff, highlighting the day session.

title: Who were the most valuable players in the NFL this season? Let's stack the top 100
content: We took the MVP conversation beyond Drake Maye vs. Matthew Stafford ... way beyond. Here are the 100 top players of the 2025 season.

title: USWNT star Trinity Rodman's record deal: Why it's a boon for her, but NWSL worries linger
content: Trinity Rodman will stay in the U.S. and play for the NWSL. Even as she rejected offers from England, it exposes the NWSL's problems retaining stars.

title: Flagg, Knueppel, Edgecombe: Who is the NBA's No. 1 rookie in our midseason rankings?
content: With the NBA now at the midpoint of its season, ESPN analyst Zach Kram ranks the top 10 rookies based on their performance.

title: Who wins the 2026 national title? We predict the CFP bracket
content: It's never too early to look ahead to next season. Some teams look like easy playoff picks, but who rounds out the field?

title: Wetzel: G League to the SEC? What are we doing here?
content: Wetzel: The NCAA needs Congress to give it a skinny exemption to at least set some eligibility standards.

title: 8 years, 5 schools and a career-threatening condition: The story of Tyon Grant-Foster
content: From heart troubles to an eligibility battle, here's how the Gonzaga forward kept his playing career alive.

title: Welcoming the HOF Class of 2026: Why Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones got in
content: Cooperstown welcomed two new players Tuesday night. Here's why the center fielders are headed to the Hall.

title: How Cooper Kupp mentored and Davante Adams elevated Puka Nacua's game
content: Puka Nacua's elite performance can be attributed to the mentorship of veteran receivers Cooper Kupp and Davante Adams.

title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

title: What NBA greats Kerr, Nash & Co. learned owning LaLiga's Mallorca
content: Steve Kerr and Steve Nash own Mallorca with a former USMNT international and an ex-tennis pro. What has it taught them about sport, leadership and life?

title: Can Mirra Andreeva make a run at the Australian Open title?
content: Andreeva won the Australian Open lead-up in Adelaide -- and could be the most likely player to upset Aryna Sabalenka, Coco Gauff or Iga Swiatek.

title: Inside the rise of Vanderbilt's Mikayla Blakes
content: From underrated to perhaps the best hoops player in the country, Mikayla Blakes is just getting started.

title: Why Frank Nazar is the Blackhawks' perfect complement to Connor Bedard
content: The 22-year-old center is slated to make his return Thursday to a team still fighting to get in the playoff mix.

title: Ranking the top 50 players in the Olympics: Why MacKinnon is No. 1
content: As 12 teams face off for gold in Milan Cortina, here are the players who will have the biggest impact.

title: Power Rankings: Miami (Ohio) debuts, Nebraska rises
content: The RedHawks crack the top 25 and the Cornhuskers climb as two of the last three unbeaten teams standing.

title: Champions League: Arsenal still perfect; top-8 fight getting messy
content: Arsenal are still top of the Champions League table, and likely to remain there, but the fight for a bye to the round of 16 is shaping up to be fierce.

title: Kyren Williams among conference championship top 30 predicted anytime TD scorers
content: Kyren Williams, Courtland Sutton and Stefon Diggs are among top predictions for anytime TD scorers on NFL conference championship weekend.

title: 'Heated Rivalry' stars named torchbearers for Milan Cortina Olympics
content: Hudson Williams and Connor Storrie, who play rival hockey players who develop a decade-long secret relationship, will be part of the torch relay.

title: Google updates Curt Cignetti search page to reflect iconic quote
content: Indiana's national champion head coach also had his signature Chipotle order added to the restaurant's app, adding to a big week on and off the field.

title: Liberty, Fever among the top 2026 WNBA schedule reveals on social media
content: The 2026 WNBA schedule is out and teams announced their calendar in their own creative ways on social media.

title: Power Rankings: Iowa, Ohio State soar into top 10 -- but can they stay there?
content: The Big Ten and Big 12 are winners as Ohio State, Iowa and Baylor crack the top 10. UConn stays No. 1.

title: Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Cooper Flagg finishes as a top-25 fantasy option, Jalen Green averages 20 PPG
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Cooper Flagg, Jalen Green, Jonathan Kuminga and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Lewandowski wants MLS move in summer
content: Robert Lewandowski could be headed to the U.S. when his Barcelona contract expires. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: US Immigration Agents Detain 5-Year-Old, School Claims He Was Used As 'Bait'
content: A 5-year-old boy arriving home from preschool in Minnesota was taken by federal agents along with his father to a detention facility in Texas, school officials and the family's lawyer said

title: Amazon Plans Thousands More Job Cuts By Next Week: Report
content: Amazon is planning a second round of job cuts next week as part of its broader goal of trimming some 30,000 corporate workers, according to two people familiar with the matter.

title: MK Stalin Seeks Amendment To Scrap Governor's Address In Assembly
content: Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin said that the DMK would consult like-minded opposition parties across the country to move a constitutional amendment abolishing the practice of the Governor's address at the start of the first session of state Assemblies.

title: Trump Says "Big Force" Heading Toward Iran, US "Closely Watching"
content: President Donald Trump said Thursday a US naval "armada" was heading toward the Gulf, maintaining pressure on Iran although he has recently downplayed the prospect of imminent military action.

title: Delhi Government's New Food Security Rules To Focus On Quota, Eligibility
content: Aiming to reform the food distribution system, the Delhi government is planning to issue ration cards based on a quota set for each district that will be determined by the population, a senior government official said on Thursday.

title: Top Naxal With Bounty Of Rs 1 Crore Killed In Jharkhand: Amit Shah
content: Union Minister Amit Shah said that in West Singhbhum, the ongoing joint operation by CRPF and Jharkhand Police has achieved a major success in the campaign to make the region free of Naxals through encounters.

title: Microsoft 365 Down For Thousands Of Users: Report
content: Microsoft's suite of productivity software was down for thousands of users on Thursday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.

title: 6 Injured In Knife Attack During Pro-Kurdish Demonstration In Belgium
content: Six people were wounded, two of them critically, in a knife attack at a Kurdish demonstration in the city of Antwerp Thursday, Belgian police said.

title: US Military Assets Heading To Middle East As Trump Softens Iran Rhetoric
content: A US military aircraft carrier strike group and other assets will arrive in the Middle East region in the coming days, two US officials said on Thursday, even as US President Donald Trump voices hopes of avoiding new military action against Iran.

title: Putin Meets US Envoys In Moscow For Ukraine Talks
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin began a meeting with three US envoys late on Thursday to discuss a plan to end the war in Ukraine, the Kremlin said.

title: "Canada Doesn't Live Because Of US": Carney Hits Back At Trump
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney hit back at President Donald Trump on Thursday, responding to the US leader's inflammatory claim at the World Economic Forum that "Canada lives because of the United States."

title: IndiGo Delhi-Pune Flight Gets Bomb Threat
content: IndiGo flight 6E 2608 from Delhi to Pune received bomb threat information upon arrival at the airport on Thursday evening, though nothing suspicious was detected after thorough checks, officials said.

title: Insurgents' Plan To Spark Violence Fails As Manipur's Thadou Tribe And Meiteis Unite
content: The killing of a Meitei man on camera in Manipur's Kuki-dominant Churachandpur district led to concerns over public anger in the Meitei-dominant valley areas reaching the streets.

title: Trump Sues JPMorgan Chase, CEO Jamie Dimon Over Alleged 'Debanking'
content: US President Donald Trump sued JPMorgan Chase and CEO Jamie Dimon on Thursday, alleging he was wrongly "debanked" for political reasons, according to a court announcement.

title: US Names New Head Of Embassy In Venezuela
content: The United States has named a new head for its embassy in Venezuela, a US diplomatic source told AFP Thursday, just under three weeks after Washington toppled the oil-rich Latin American country's leader.

title: Explained: Russia, China's Presence In The Arctic
content: While Russia and China strongly deny any plans to seize Greenland, as US President Donald Trump claims, both value the Arctic's strategic value and are seeking to boost their presence there

title: "There's No Time Limit": Trump Says Greenland Agreement Still Being Negotiated
content: President Donald Trump said the details of a U.S. agreement over Greenland were still being worked out on Thursday, speaking one day after he stepped back from a tariff threat and ruled out the use of force to seize the Danish territory.

title: South Korean Law To Regulate AI Takes Effect
content: South Korea became the first country to have a wide-ranging law regulating artificial intelligence take full effect on Thursday, including specific provisions targeting deepfakes.

title: Yuvraj Mehta Tragedy Exposes Widespread Open Drains In 'Smart City' Noida
content: The drowning death of 27-year-old software engineer Yuvraj Mehta in a fog-shrouded, water-filled pit in Sector 150 continues to fuel public outrage, with residents calling it as a case of "institutional systematic murder" rooted in chronic neglect.

title: California Governor Says Trump Destroyed '80 Years Of Alliances'
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom accused US President Donald Trump on Thursday of destroying alliances forged at the end of the Second World War, saying the United States had "become unrecognisable in a matter of months".

title: MHA notifies Census 2027 schedule, lists 33 questions
content: India's upcoming Census 2027 will collect detailed household information, including building materials, amenities like water and sanitation, and ownership status. For the first time since 1931, caste details will be gathered. The houselisting and housing phase runs April-September 2026, with population enumeration in February 2027.

title: Rain lashes parts of Delhi; thunderstorms forecast, maximum temperature likely to drop to 18‚Äì20¬∞C
content: Delhi experienced light rain on Friday as an active western disturbance brought showers, thunderstorms, and gusty winds. This follows an unusually warm Thursday, with temperatures expected to drop significantly over the weekend. The rain is also predicted to improve the city's air quality.

title: 'Your captain is Hindu': Ex-India cricketer warns Bangladesh over shifting T20 WC matches
content: Former cricketer Atul Wassan urged Bangladesh to resolve tensions with India regarding the T20 World Cup 2026, suggesting Litton Das's captaincy as a bridge. He dismissed the BCB's request to shift matches as logistically impossible and impractical, emphasizing India's robust security. The ICC confirmed matches will remain in India, despite the BCB's continued stance.

title: Middle East $50 Billion Round: OpenAI seeks new funding amid crisis; Noble warns of chaos
content: OpenAI is reportedly seeking a massive $50 billion investment from Middle Eastern funds amidst growing concerns about its financial stability and competitive edge. Veteran investor George Noble warns the AI giant is "falling apart in real time," citing internal "Code Red" alerts, declining ChatGPT traffic, and staggering losses.  Talent departures and a lawsuit from Elon Musk further compound these issues.

title: A match made in open jail: Two life-term convicts to marry in Rajasthan
content: Two convicts serving life sentences for separate high-profile murder cases are set to marry after developing a relationship in Jaipur's open-air prison. Both Priya Seth and Hanuman Prasad were granted 15-day parole to facilitate their wedding in Alwar. The parole decision is facing opposition from the victim's family in Seth's case.

title: Lula discusses strategic ties with PM Modi, to visit in February
content: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will visit India from February 19-21 to strengthen the strategic partnership and discuss bilateral cooperation for the Global South. The leaders pledged to work together for UNSC reforms and peace in Gaza, with Lula also expected to attend the AI summit and a later BRICS summit.

title: Workplace shake-up: Deloitte to rename job titles for thousands in the US; ‚ÄòLeader‚Äô roles added
content: Deloitte is overhauling job titles for all 181,500 US employees starting June 1, 2026, as part of a modernization drive influenced by AI. The consulting giant aims to better align roles with evolving client demands and employee career aspirations. New senior leadership designations will also be introduced, promising greater clarity and market relevance across all divisions.

title: 'Stop the World Cup': Pakistan urged to boycott T20 WC in support of Bangladesh
content: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif urged the PCB to boycott the T20 World Cup, supporting Bangladesh's security concerns. He believes Pakistan should challenge the cricket power structure by withdrawing, as their participation is crucial to the tournament's success. Latif questioned the ICC's dismissal of Bangladesh's relocation request, emphasizing the potential for sanctions but stressing the importance of taking a stand.

title: Patrick Mahomes questioned Travis Kelce‚Äôs Taylor Swift romance before seeing it
content: Patrick Mahomes revealed he initially doubted Travis Kelce‚Äôs relationship with Taylor Swift until she appeared at Arrowhead Stadium. ESPN‚Äôs The Kingdom showed locker room disbelief, massive fan buzz, and how Swift‚Äôs presence reshaped game day energy. Teammates admitted the attention was overwhelming, yet the Chiefs stayed focused and won.

title: Supreme Court rejects privacy plea, allows ED to access I-PAC man's phone
content: The Supreme Court refused to stop the ED from accessing information from an I-PAC functionary's seized mobile phone, despite pleas of privacy violation. The court stated it knows how to protect innocent citizens. This comes as ED faced interruptions in Kolkata during a search, unlike in Delhi.

title: South Korea AI law: Startups fear regulatory risk; Government targets global AI lead
content: South Korea has launched the AI Basic Act, the world's first comprehensive legal framework for artificial intelligence, aiming to become a global AI powerhouse. While the law mandates human oversight in high-impact areas and clear AI-generated content labeling, local startups express concerns about "regulatory risk" stifling innovation, despite a one-year grace period for compliance.

title: WPL: Sophie Devine stars! Gujarat Giants crush UP Warriorz by 45 runs
content: Sophie Devine's stellar all-round performance, featuring an unbeaten 50 and two wickets, powered Gujarat Giants to a dominant 45-run victory over UP Warriorz.  After posting 153/8, the Giants' disciplined bowling attack, spearheaded by Rajeshwari Gayakwad's three wickets, restricted UP to 108, ending a three-match losing streak and propelling Gujarat to second in the WPL standings.

title: 'Dhurandhar' collection: Ranveer Singh starrer earns Rs 13.9 cr ahead of 'Border 2'
content: 'Dhurandhar' starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna has completed its seventh week, achieving its lowest collection yet at Rs 1.1 crore but still surpassing Rs 1 crore. The film has set a new record for week 7 earnings, reaching a total of Rs 13.9 crore. Its impressive Rs 830.

title: Gracie Hunt hints at how she‚Äôs coping with Chiefs‚Äô tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs‚Äô billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has been a constant presence on the field as she has stayed by the team‚Äôs side through all the good and bad days. While the Kansas City Chiefs have had a pretty disappointing end in the ongoing season, the 26 year old billionaire heiress has hinted at how she has been coping with it.

title: Taylor Swift turns romance with Travis Kelce into new creative project: Report
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce‚Äôs romance has inspired billions around the world with the love, respect and commitment they have shown towards each other.While there have been reports that their high profile wedding might have been delayed, it seems Taylor Swift is already working on a new thing. To make it more interesting, her new project will be heavily inspired by her relationship with Travis Kelce.

title: Quote of the day: Patrick Mahomes on never losing hope in adverse times
content: Patrick Mahomes might be a young player but the Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback has easily inspired a generation of fans both on and off the field. As many of the Chiefs' fans remain stressed about his potential return to the field in the next season, Patrick Mahomes' words prove that he is not the one to give up very easily.

title: Triple talaq-halala FIR puts focus on legal grey area
content: An FIR in UP details a woman's alleged gang-rape under the guise of 'halala' after an instant triple talaq. The law banning triple talaq has been invoked, alongside provisions for rape and other offenses. This case highlights the legal grey area surrounding halala, a practice not recognized by Indian statutory law.

title: T20 WC row: Bangladesh cite India's 'privilege'; accuse ICC of double standards
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board accuses ICC of double standards after its request to move T20 World Cup matches out of India was rejected. The BCB cited safety concerns, contrasting the ICC's past flexibility in allowing India to play the 2025 Champions Trophy at a neutral venue.

title: Missouri man sells a car to eight people on Facebook, then steals it back within 24 hours every time
content: A Kansas City man faces 14 felony counts for allegedly running a Facebook Marketplace scam, selling vehicles to multiple buyers and then stealing them back. Prosecutors say Mamadou Diallo used forged paperwork, convincing victims to pay thousands before the cars disappeared. The scheme reportedly occurred across at least eight sales in May and June 2025.

title: HC: Apart from refunds, how will you compensate flyers?
content: Delhi High Court has asked IndiGo to explain how it will compensate passengers affected by mass flight cancellations last December. The court noted that refunds are not the same as compensation. IndiGo is offering Rs 10,000 vouchers to some passengers. The court wants a detailed affidavit on compensation plans. Authorities have taken steps to prevent future disruptions.

title: Engineer shoots wife accidentally; distressed by death, he kills self
content: Tragedy struck in Ahmedabad as Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil's nephew, Yashrajsinh Gohil, allegedly shot his wife Rajeshwari accidentally with a licensed revolver.  Devastated by her death, he then reportedly took his own life. Police are investigating the incident, which occurred late Wednesday night in their apartment.

title: J&K: Armoured carrier skids off mountain road in Doda; 10 soldiers killed, 11 injured
content: Ten brave Army soldiers lost their lives and eleven were injured when their troop carrier veered off a treacherous mountain road in Doda, Jammu & Kashmir, plunging into a deep gorge. The vehicle was en route to a counterterrorism operation. This tragic incident highlights the persistent dangers faced by military personnel in the region's challenging terrain.

title: OpenAI concerns: Google AI CEO on Sam Altman; ‚ÄòMaybe he‚Äôs realised what everyone is worried about‚Äô
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue push. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.

title: IMD predicts heavy snow in Jammu & Kashmir this week, 232 expectant moms hospitalised in Kulgam
content: Heavy snowfall is expected in Kashmir Valley and Pir Panjal regions starting Friday. Two western disturbances will impact the weather for nearly a week. Authorities are preparing for the harsh winter spell. Moderate to heavy rainfall and snowfall are forecast for south and north Kashmir. High-altitude areas may receive significant snow. Farmers are advised to postpone agricultural activities.

title: Don't air internal issues in public: Congress warns Punjab leaders
content: Congress has issued a strong directive to its Punjab leaders, demanding an end to public displays of internal discord and factionalism. Party president Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi emphasized unity for the 2027 assembly elections, assuring no immediate leadership changes. Leaders must raise concerns internally, not through media, to present a united front for victory.

title: Pune Grand Tour | 'Never seen such a big crowd': How India and Indians embrace cycling
content: Massive crowds, curiosity and warmth defined the Pune Grand Tour as India embraced elite international cycling with rare fervour. From Saswad to Baramati, spectators lined roads normally meant for everyday life, leaving visiting teams stunned by the turnout and hospitality. Beyond results and jerseys, the inaugural race revealed India‚Äôs untapped appetite for global sporting spectacles.

title: Quote of the day by Ralph Waldo Emerson: ‚ÄúThe purpose of life is not to be happy...‚Äù
content: Nineteenth-century thinker Ralph Waldo Emerson challenged the notion that life's sole purpose is happiness. He argued that true fulfillment stems from being useful, honorable, and compassionate. Living a life of integrity and making a positive difference, however small, creates lasting meaning and satisfaction, far beyond fleeting joy. This perspective encourages a focus on contribution over acquisition.

title: Oscar 2026 nominations: Timothee Chalamet, Emma Stone shatter records
content: The 98th Academy Awards nominations have shattered records! Timoth√©e Chalamet and Emma Stone achieved significant milestones, while 'Sinners' made history with a record 16 nominations. Ruth E. Carter became the most nominated Black woman, and Wagner Moura marked a first for Brazilian actors in the Best Actor category. International cinema also shone with notable nods.

title: Golden Dome: Trump's Greenland U-turn & the ‚Äòframework deal‚Äô ‚Äî 10 things to know
content: US President Trump claims a framework deal on Arctic sovereignty and tariffs with Nato chief Rutte, sparking confusion. Denmark and Greenland deny any Nato mandate for such talks. The proposed deal involves US military bases with limited sovereignty and a missile defence system, aiming to counter Russia and China's influence.

title: Ryan Coogler‚Äôs 'Sinners' makes history with 16 nominations at the 98th Academy Awards
content: In a groundbreaking achievement, Ryan Coogler's 'Sinners,' a vampire thriller featuring Michael B. Jordan, has dominated the 98th Academy Awards with an unprecedented 16 nominations. The film is making waves in major categories like Best Picture and Best Director, surpassing all previous records and marking a monumental milestone for the film industry and its visionary creators.

title: ‚ÄòJason has‚Ä¶‚Äô: Travis Kelce‚Äôs playful announcement drops amid breakup rumors
content: Travis Kelce shared a surprising update about brother Jason Kelce on the Jan. 22 episode of ‚ÄúNew Heights,‚Äù announcing the former Eagles center‚Äôs move to TikTok. The moment arrives as Travis weighs retirement after a 6-11 Chiefs season and faces ongoing Taylor Swift breakup rumors, with sources saying his career decision will come by early April.

title: 'Is CM so helpless': HC raps Maharashtra govt; Sena minister's son evades arrest
content: The Bombay High Court sharply questioned the Maharashtra government's adherence to the rule of law, asking if the Chief Minister was too "helpless" to act against a minister whose son has evaded arrest for weeks. The court's remarks came after the police failed to apprehend the minister's son following the rejection of his pre-arrest bail plea.

title: Gag order issued in Kumar Sanu‚Äôs Rs 50 crore defamation suit against ex-wife Rita Bhattacharya
content: The Bombay High Court on Wednesday granted interim relief to Bollywood playback singer Kumar Sanu in his Rs 50 crore defamation suit against his ex-wife Rita Bhattacharya. Justice Milind Jadhav passed a gag order restraining Bhattacharya and certain independent media houses from writing, speaking, posting or publishing any allegedly defamatory, false or slanderous statements about the singer or his family across any platform.

title: Handshake row returns: Pakistan takes dig at India ahead of T20 World Cup ‚Äì Watch
content: Pakistan's T20 series promo against Australia subtly reignites the handshake controversy with India. A video suggests a tourist forgot to shake hands, implying they learned this from India. This comes after Indian players previously avoided handshakes with Pakistani counterparts following terror attacks. The series is a build-up to the T20 World Cup.

title: Explained: How BMC mayor is elected; quota, lottery, voting and the power play behind Mumbai‚Äôs top civic post
content: Mumbai's BMC mayoral race is a high-stakes political battle for control of Asia's richest civic body, extending beyond the ceremonial post. A fractured 2026 election mandate has forced uneasy allies BJP and Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena into intense negotiations, with real power residing in key committees.

title: From saas-bahu to Sussex: Beckhams and Meghan Markle play the same script
content: This is why the ongoing Beckham family fallout and the long, slow implosion of Meghan Markle‚Äôs relationship with the British Royal Family belong in the same analytical universe. Not because one involves footballers and fashion designers while the other involves crowns and castles, but because both are stories about institutions mistaking themselves for families, families mistaking discipline for love, and younger generations refusing to accept that inheritance must come with silence as its price.

title: Actor-producer files Rs 40 lakh cheating complaint against Palaash Muchhal in Sangli
content: A 34-year-old actor and producer has approached the police in Maharashtra‚Äôs Sangli district, alleging that he was cheated of Rs 40 lakh by composer and filmmaker Palaash Muchhal. Police confirmed on Thursday that no First Information Report (FIR) has been registered so far in the matter.

title: 'World‚Äôs biggest flop family': Assam CM Himanta takes dig at Gandhis; claims he is 'victim' of Rahul-Priyanka rift
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma claims he was a "victim" of a rift between Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi during his Congress tenure. He also accused Assam Congress president Gaurav Gogoi and his wife of having links with Pakistan's ISI, emphasizing national security concerns.

title: RCB sale: Adar Poonawalla to place 'strong bid'; confirms plan to buy IPL franchise
content: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla is preparing a strong bid to acquire the Indian Premier League's Royal Challengers Bengaluru franchise. This follows Diageo's decision to put RCB up for sale after their maiden IPL title win in 2025. The franchise, a fan favorite, has a rich history and has seen legendary players grace its ranks.

title: Who has highest batting average in Test history? Short answer: It‚Äôs not Bradman
content: Born 105 years ago, Andy Ganteaume etched his name in cricket history with a solitary Test century for the West Indies. His debut 112 against England in 1948, in front of his home crowd, remains his only international innings. This remarkable feat propelled him to a Test batting average of 112, surpassing even Sir Don Bradman's legendary record.

title: You‚Äôre 'not addicted' to screen: What is doomscrolling and why it feels impossible to stop?
content: Late-night scrolling through distressing news, known as doomscrolling, is a stress response, not a lack of discipline. Our brains, wired for survival, interpret constant negative information as a threat, leading to anxiety and sleep issues. Understanding this helps shift focus from self-blame to managing stress and practicing digital hygiene for peace

title: 'Acting like party agents': Stalin wants guv address scrapped; to consult like-minded parties
content: DMK will consult opposition parties to move amendment to end governor's address . comes after a series of confrontations in opposition-ruled states . governors refused to read state government-approved speeches and behaving like party agents, underminimizing elected governments .

title: SIR order makes no mention of citizenship verification: SC to EC
content: EC's counsel said the order did not state that verification of citizenship was one of the reasons for conducting the exercise . a bench of chief justice Surya Kant and justice Joymalya Bagchi said the exercise was also about illegal immigration .

title: 'Real estate person at heart': At Board of Peace event, Trump calls Gaza beautiful piece of property
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: MLB offseason grades: Rating fits for Gore in Texas, Peralta in NY
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: TikTok to avoid US ban: Majority American-led joint venture formed with Chinese ownership
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: Midseason report card: Cooper Flagg 'better than advertised'
content: Cooper Flagg is the youngest player in NBA history to surpass 40 points in a game . he is expected to be the rare no. 1 pick who gets playoff experience right away . the mavs are 18-26 and in 12th place in the Western Conference .

title: Barnwell sorts out the wide receiver market: 20 free agents, trade targets and cut candidates
content: the 49ers are competing for a trip to the super bowl this weekend in the NFC Championship Game . the two most productive wideouts in football are the Rams ' Puka Nacua and the Seahawks' Jaxon Smith-Njigba .

title: The Hall of Fame has a starting pitcher problem. Here's what it means for today's aces
content: CC Sabathia is the only starting pitcher voted into the Hall of Fame this decade . the 2010s saw a spate of starters enshrined, a group composed largely of the last of the greats who were used in more or less traditional fashion .

title: Reranking Freshman of the Year contenders
content: Darryn Peterson scored 26 points on 11-of-13 shooting in a nationally televised win over Baylor on friday . he has played in at least 50% of his team's games . the performance helped him qualify for our rankings .

title: 'First trilateral meet': Zelenskyy says US-Russia-Ukraine talks in UAE; peace docs nearly ready
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: ‚ÄòWhy detain a five-year-old?‚Äô: ICE arrest sparks outrage across Minnesota schools
content: masked ICE agents detained five-year-old as he arrived home from school . they then took the child from the car and instructed him to knock on the door . he was refused permission to take care of the child, but was refused .

title: How to reach the UCL knockouts: Can Chelsea, Bar√ßa avoid the playoff round?
content: the knockout rounds of the 2025-26 UEFA champions league are fast approaching . the final matchweek of the league phase must be played, and the stakes could hardly be higher for some of the continent's biggest clubs . liverpool , barcelona , chelsea and manchester city also competing for top eight spots .

title: Expert picks: 'The Highlight' is a bad matchup for 'The Baddy'
content: a matchup between lightweight fan favorites will headline the first fight card since Dec. 13 . paddy Pimblett, ESPN's no. 7-ranked lightweight, is undefeated in the UFC . his last win was a third-round knockout of Michael Chandler .

title: 10 must-see WNBA games for the 2026 season
content: the WNBA released its 2026 regular-season schedule on friday . the league will tip off its 30th season on may 8 . at the top of the list is a new CBA . a moratorium on league business as negotiations continue .

title: The human cost behind every delivery
content: The Union government‚Äôs directive to quick-commerce platforms to drop the concept of 10-minute deliveries owing to the excessive stress it puts delivery personnel under has been welcomed by gig workers, but they say it is just the tip of the iceberg. Low pay, inadequate incentives, poor safety measures and mistreatment at work all threaten their livelihoods, writes Harish Gilai

title: 44 years on, closed dye factory‚Äôs contaminating colours still remain underground in Kochi
content: The unit produced Rhodamine-B, a fluorescent dye used mostly in textile, leather and cosmetics industries

title: Hesaraghatta Grassland: Is the grass greener with the new tag?
content: A year after the Hesaraghatta Grasslands got the conservation reserve tag, K.C. Deepika visits the area to see if there has been a transformation from ‚Äòwasteland‚Äô to a biodiversity hotspot

title: Auroral activity captured at Hanle by IIA‚Äôs all-sky camera
content: This is the sixth time during the current solar cycle that the intense red coloured auroral activity was captured by the all-sky camera

title: The Ponzi playbook in Telangana: built on trust, broken by fraud
content: Promising high returns and low risk, Ponzi schemes are quietly draining household savings across Telangana and beyond. Behind polished apps, corporate facades and reassuring payouts lies a carefully engineered cycle of trust, timing and collapse.¬†Lavpreet Kaur¬†examines how such frauds flourish amid regulatory gaps

title: India condemns incident of trespassing, vandalism at its embassy in Croatia
content: The MEA said it has taken up the matter ‚Äústrongly‚Äù with Croatian authorities, both in New Delhi and in Zagreb and asked them to hold the perpetrators accountable for their ‚Äúreprehensible‚Äù actions

title: IndiGo Delhi-Pune flight gets bomb threat; nothing suspicious found after thorough checks
content: Following the assessment, the aircraft was thoroughly checked by the Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad, the official said, adding no suspicious or adverse findings were detected

title: How¬†V.O. Chidambaram Pillai earned the title¬† ‚ÄòSekkizhutha¬†Chemmal‚Äô
content: VOC¬†was arrested on the charge of sedition on March 12, 1908.¬†A British jailer noticed his hands bleeding from the harsh labour of separating¬†coir¬†and spinning rope in the¬†Coimbatore¬†prison. Hence, he advised him to work at the oil press instead.¬†VOC¬† accepted the suggestion and pulled the oil press himself, a task normally reserved for bulls

title: When¬†E.V.K.¬†Sampath hit the headlines in Tamil Nadu
content: Sampath, nephew of¬†E.V.¬†Ramasamy, enjoyed a special relationship with¬†DMK¬†founder¬†C.N.¬†Annadurai.¬†Before other¬†DMK¬†leaders, he realised the futility of pursuing the demand for a¬†Dravida¬†Nadu. He quit the¬†DMK¬†in 1961 and founded a party, which he merged with the Congress. Sampath‚Äôs¬†birth centenary falls on March 6, 2026.

title: Vadasery‚Äôs temple jewellery: a craft caught between heritage and high gold, silver prices
content: Temple jewellery continues to survive with its distinctive manufacturing method and rich antiquity.¬†But the artisans of Vadasery¬†in¬†Nagercoil, who practise the craft, are buffeted by the drop in demand with gold and silver prices going up

title: A natural heater hidden in India‚Äôs ‚Äòsacred lotus‚Äô flowers
content: When these pretty flowers bloom for three to four days, their internal temperature is around 30-35¬∫ C even as the surrounding temperature can go down to 10¬∫ C

title: Killed for a cow: A mob lynching in Odisha and deepening mistrust between communities
content: On January 14, a man was beaten to death in Odisha‚Äôs Balasore district on suspicion of his involvement in what is now being called cattle trafficking by the police.¬†Satyasundar Barik¬†visits the family to piece together the events of that day, and examine how cattle trading is emerging as a flashpoint, deepening mistrust between majority and minority communities

title: Uttarakhand Congress MLA's son staged own attack; absconds after revelation
content: Three masked assailants on a two-wheeler allegedly attacked Mr. Raj with sticks and rods, seriously injuring him. He was admitted to the ICU for several hours

title: Education Ministry sets up three-member team to review cases of student suicides at IIT-Kanpur
content: Two students have ended their lives at IIT-Kanpur within the past month, prompting the government to set up the committee

title: India‚Äôs reform momentum is firmly on track: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Union Minister says landmark reforms undertaken in the past few years, such as labour code reforms and simplification of the Goods and Services Tax, are generating strong investor confidence across sectors

title: Stalin launches Sprint 1; now, register properties without visiting Sub Registrar‚Äôs office
content: While ‚Äòpaperless registration‚Äô is now available for all 30 deed types, ‚Äòpresenceless registration ‚Äôis available for 10 types of documents including sale deeds, sale agreements, and lease deeds

title: Court acquits Sajjan Kumar in 1984 anti-Sikh riots case
content: Prosecution failed to prove guilt beyond reasonable doubt, says court;¬†case relates to an FIR over killing of two men in Janakpuri on November 1, 1984; victims‚Äô kin call the acquittal an ‚Äòinjustice‚Äô

title: Tariffs imposed by President Trump punitive, counterproductive for the US: Matt Winkler
content: Referring to its impact on India, he said¬†the country faced the biggest five-month export decline since 1960 between April and August 2025

title: Government asks airlines to submit requests for IndiGo‚Äôs vacated slots
content: Following massive disruptions, DGCA reduced IndiGo's winter schedule by 10%, which meant the airline had stopped operating services in various slots

title: Kerala Literature Festival gets under way
content: American astronaut¬†Sunita¬†Williams and Tourism Minister jointly inaugurate the four-day festival, which will conclude on January 25, 2026

title: Kerala secures investment commitments worth $14 billion at Davos
content: These proposals range across sectors ‚Äî renewable energy, GCC, skill development, financial services, tourism, wellness, medical infrastructure, and medical device manufacturing

title: Startup revolution key to growth in space technology, says NRSC Director
content: Observation of earth, communication and navigation satellites are critical for agriculture, disaster management, climate monitoring, transport and digital services, says Dr. Prakash Chauhan

title: Woman, paramour held for ‚Äòmurdering‚Äô husband in Guntur district
content: The woman allegedly served her husband biryani laced with sleeping pills before smothering him with a pillow, say police

title: Command control centre at Dr. NTRUHS to monitor exams in A.P. medical colleges
content: Authorities can monitor the examinations at 37 medical colleges in the State from this facility, says Health Minister

title: PM Modi speaks to Brazil's Lula, says ties key for interests of Global South
content: The two leaders reaffirmed their commitment to further strengthen the India-Brazil Strategic Partnership and take it to even greater heights in the year ahead, the statement said

title: Census 2027 first phase to have 33 questions
content: The questions include Census house number, material of floor of the house, whether the head of the household belongs to a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe, main source of drinking water, and access to toilet

title: A.P., Telangana discuss student development initiatives
content: APSCHE Chairman K. Madhu Murthy and TGCHE Chairman V. Balakista Reddy discuss promoting research and innovation and fostering institutional partnerships

title: Portal to regularise violation of land use norms operational: Minister
content: Minister for Revenue K. Rajan said people could apply through the www.klarc.kerala.gov.in portal from Friday.

title: Eknath Shinde should support Uddhav Thackeray in BMC, says Sena (UBT) leader
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) has 65 seats in BMC. Eknath Shinde has 29 seats. The magic figure for power in BMC is 114.

title: At global meet, CEC Gyanesh¬†Kumar offers ECINet model to help fight election misinformation
content: On the second day of the International Conference on Democracy and Election Management, Gyanesh Kumar noted that the heads of various poll management bodies had shared their concerns during the conference on the threat of misinformation to democracy

title: Interfaith couple hacked to death in Moradabad
content: The woman‚Äôs brothers were opposed to the interfaith relationship, and confessed to killing the couple

title: PM Modi to launch development projects in Thiruvananthapuram city on  Friday
content: Projects span key sectors, including rail connectivity, urban livelihoods, science and innovation, citizen-centric services, and advanced health-care

title: Why ‚Äòillegal immigration‚Äô was not cited as reason for SIR, Supreme Court asks EC
content: SC says poll body seemed to been referring more to inter-State migration and not cross-border illegal movement to conduct the SIR; verification of citizenship was not needed if an elector had moved from one State to another

title: India absent as Trump rolls out his Board of Peace with 19 countries in attendance
content: The U.S. President‚Äôs attempt to create momentum for a project to map out a future of the war-torn Gaza Strip has been overshadowed this week, first by his threats to seize Greenland, then by a dramatic retreat from that push

title: Centre permits State to procure 1.01 lakh tonnes of Bengal gram
content: Union Minister for Agriculture Shivraj Singh Chouhan asccuses State government of failing to meet procurement targets of toor dal and tothapuri mango

content: He calls for the government to convene a meeting of broiler chicken farmers, poultry companies, and the Animal Husbandry Department
